ingredients: 1 apple, cored and cut into chunks
Your favorite burrito fillings (e.g., scrambled eggs, black beans, cheese, salsa, avocado)
instructions: Bring the water to a boil in a saucepan.
Add the oats, salt, and apple chunks. Cook over medium heat for 7-10 minutes, or until oats are tender, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon, brown sugar, and nutmeg (if using).
Lay out a large tortilla or wrap.
Spread the cooked oatmeal evenly over the tortilla.
Top with your prepared burrito fillings.
Fold the sides of the tortilla inwards and then roll up tightly from the bottom to create a burrito.
cooking_tips: For a creamier oatmeal, use milk instead of water.
Add a handful of raisins, cranberries, or other dried fruits along with the oats for extra flavor and texture.
If you prefer a sweeter burrito, add a drizzle of honey or maple syrup.
You can also add a sprinkle of chopped nuts or seeds for added crunch.
For a savory burrito, omit the cinnamon, brown sugar, and nutmeg, and use savory fillings like cooked sausage, bacon, or vegetables.
